features: Easy Set up & Auto Connect: Caymuller wireless microphones are very easy to set up.No adapter, Bluetooth, messy cables or Application needed. You just simply plug the receiver into your device(Lightning port), then tuen on the portable microphone, and the two parts will pair automatically. (Notes: if they don't match successfully, just turn off the device and try again).

Omnidirectional Sound Reception& Clear Sound Quality: Built-in intelligent active noise reduction chips, no matter in any noisy environment, our equipment can provide effective original sound recognition and clearly record every detail of sound. Addition, equipped with advanced High Density Spray-proof Sponge, reduce wind noise and clutter AI algorithm intelligent noise reduction module accurately filters all types of noise, has strong anti-interference ability and ensures sound quality.

Rechargeable transmitter and receiver & Long Battery Life: Built in upgrated 85MAH rechargeable batteries, you can use this wireless lavalier microphone up to 8 hours with only 1.5 hours charging time. While using the lavalier mic, you can charge your device at the same time. This microphones are only compatible with Lightning devices (iPhone/iPad) , can not be used for Android devices unless you have a proper adapter.

Universal wireless system: The dual wireless microphones completely get rid of the shackles of wires, allowing you to complete mobile phone recording, dynamic shooting, and video production in various scenarios. iPhone lavalier microphone, just clip the microphone to your clothes to free your hands and record from a distance. 66 feet of stable audio signal transmission without cables, allowing you to clearly record or shoot videos at a greater distance indoors or outdoors.

Full Compatibility: Our upgraded dual Wireless lavalier microphone is compatible with IOS smartphones, iPad, etc. The clip-on microphone is very lightweight and easy to carry, which is suitable for video recording, live streaming, podcasting, interviewing, online conferencing, vlogging,Youtube, Tiktok or more.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2024
reviews.reviewText: They work so good the audio is amazing I would love to review more products on my yt channel

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Super Easy, Works Well
reviews.reviewText: This is the fourth set of this microphone I've gotten this year -- I got the first three for work to help us record presentations. And they worked so well, I got this set for my own use at home.They're easy to use and the sound quality is solid. Both microphones are usb C for charging, and charge in less than a couple of hours. The receiver just plugs into the bottom of your phone (they make ones for iphone and for usbC android phones). You press the button on the microphone and pair them with your phone through the normal Bluetooth process. Both microphones can work at the same time.We've used them for three hours in a row without running out of battery. I'm not sure how long it could last at maximum, but it's more than three hours.It's not a professional-grade set up, but you're not a professional YouTuber. These mics work easily and well, and they're going to make the sound quality on your videos a million times better. Five stars.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Solves one of the most irritating problems of working remote
reviews.reviewText: If memes and Tik Tok are any indication, meeting with people remotely is a pretty common pain point in the modern distributed enterprise. It's worse than just "your microphone is on mute"- a common pattern with people working long hours and trying to juggle "life on the side" is switching from desktop to phone or tablet, and not getting the same sound quality on the mobile device, especially from the microphone. While the "life on the side" issue is another problem businesses need to address, this little device fixes the problem of mic quality while on the move.I admit I didn't realize these were a thing until I saw this on Amazon. I have taken a few calls now while walking around the neighborhood- far better than participating in a call while seated in a chair. This mic filters out loud sound perfectly- I walked by a landscape team blowing and vacuuming leaves, two honking cars, and a lot of traffic, with no "can you mute your mic" or other distractions (meeting with a boss so they would have said something if there was any issue with the sound quality).Here's hoping this mic gets me on my feet more, as I'm able to safely/reliably join work conversations away from my desk.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2024
reviews.reviewText: These little mics have been working very well for the past month. My daughter actually uses it in conjunction with her phone. She has a hearing impairment so her hearing aides are connected to her phone which then connects to these mics. She gives the mic to her professors to clip onto themselves when lecturing and this enables her to hear them more clearly. The mics last about a couple hours and charges very fast with the USB-C inputs.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Can be a definite improvement for the audio of your YouTube videos
reviews.reviewText: I've tried a few of these microphone sets, and I think they are probably basically the same, but in a slightly different package. In any case, they work just fine. They tend to reject more background noise than your phone's built-in mic, and (as long as the foam windscreens are in place) also help reject wind noise when making videos outside. The audio quality isn't stellar, but it's good--and it can be a definite improvement, particularly if your phone is set up at a distance of several feet, since the microphones stay clipped right to your shirt or collar. So I think they are definitely worth the money and can be a useful part of your podcasting or YouTube toolkit. One thing to remember--you'll have to select "external mic" in your camera app, so if your built-in camera app doesn't provide that feature, try the free app "Open Camera" available on the Play Store for Android phones.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2024
reviews.reviewText: It's legit plug and play, it also sounds great. It comes with two mics for recording and the wireless receiver plugs directly into your iPhone port.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2023
reviews.reviewText: My husband sometimes has to conduct meetings and interviews that may be recorded and used later. When I saw this little microphone set, I thought it might make the audio quality a little bit more clear, but I didn't expect it to do such a great job. We conducted several different test interviews withou tthe microphone, with Only one, and with both. What A difference! The noise-cancelling seems to be pretty solid as well,though since it was not a windy day, we could only test that feature using a table fan. Nonetheless, there was very little detectable sound interruption when we played it back. Excellent product to meet our needs and a great value for the price!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2024
reviews.reviewText: The range isn't terrific and it tends to experience drop-outs mwith both mics paired. The included windscreens also seeem to be more for show than function. I would also prefer something more cross-platform compatible as this unit is dependent on IOS to work and cannot be adapted to usb-c or Windows/Android hosts.
